definition: one of less than average weight, a boxer in a weight division having a maximum limit of 135 pounds for professionals and 132 pounds for amateurs — compare featherweight, welterweight
one of little consequence or ability
a person who becomes inebriated after consuming relatively small amounts of alcohol or drugs
examples: Even at 6 foot 5 inches tall, Dean was a lightweight, and he sounded to be two drinks in, Johnson said.

definition: lacking in earnestness, ability, or profundity : inconsequential
of, relating to, or characteristic of a lightweight
